definition: A way to pass data through the component tree without having to pass props down manually at every level.
A component that provides data to its children via the context API.
A component that consumes data from a provider component via the context API.
A hook that allows functional components to consume data from a provider component via the context API.
A predictable state container for JavaScript apps.
A single source of truth for the state of the entire application.
A plain JavaScript object that describes a change in the state of the application.
A pure function that takes the current state and an action, and returns the new state.
A function that sends an action to the store to update the state of the application.
A higher-order function that connects a React component to the Redux store.
A function that extracts a specific piece of data from the state of the application.
A function that intercepts actions before they reach the reducer, allowing for side effects such as logging or asynchronous API calls.
Not capable of being changed.
The concept of not changing data directly, but instead creating a new copy of the data with the desired changes.
A function that creates an action object.
A function that delays the evaluation of an expression.
A middleware for Redux that handles side effects such as asynchronous API calls.
A browser extension that provides a visual interface for debugging Redux applications.
A library that provides bindings between React and Redux.
A library that provides utilities and abstractions to simplify common Redux use cases.
